001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import static squidpony.squidmath.FastNoise.grad2f;
006import static squidpony.squidmath.Noise.fastFloor;
007
008/**
009 * A Noise class that's here for compatibility; it extends {@link SeededNoise} and delegates to it for all methods
010 * except {@link #noiseAlt(double, double)} and {@link #noiseAlt(double, double, double)}. Normally you should use
011 * SeededNoise directly for new code if you expect to mostly use the inner classes in {@link Noise} for special effects,
012 * or {@link FastNoise} if you want the effects all in one place or to use {@code float} instead of {@code double}.
013 * <br>
014 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2016. The technique for point hashing in the "noiseAlt" code is based closely on
015 * <a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.140.3594&amp;rep=rep1&amp;type=pdf">this paper</a>,
016 * with credit to Andrew Kensler, Aaron Knoll and Peter Shirley. This technique is good, but it may be periodic in
017 * undesirable ways, and isn't much faster when implemented in Java than {@link IntPointHash}, if at all.
018 */
019public class WhirlingNoise extends SeededNoise implements Noise.Noise2D, Noise.Noise3D, Noise.Noise4D, Noise.Noise6D,
020        Serializable {
021
022    private static final long serialVersionUID = 6L;
023    public static final WhirlingNoise instance = new WhirlingNoise();
024    public WhirlingNoise()
025    {
026        this(123456789);
027    }
028    public WhirlingNoise(long seed) {
029        super(seed);
030//        System.out.println("{");
031//        for (int i = 0; i < grad3f.length; i++) {
032//            System.out.printf("{% 2.15ff, % 2.15ff, % 2.15ff},\n", grad3f[i][0], grad3f[i][1], grad3f[i][2]);
033//        }
034//        System.out.println("}");
035    }

038     * The 32 3D vertices of a rhombic triacontahedron. These were modified from values taken from Vladimir Bulatov's
039     * stellation applet, which has available source but is unlicensed, and is
040     * <a href="http://www.bulatov.org/polyhedra/stellation_applet/index.html">available here</a>, but the vertices are
041     * mathematical constants so copyright isn't an issue.
042     */

158    //    protected static double dot(final float g[], final double x, final double y, final double z) {
159//        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y + g[2] * z;
160//    }
161//    protected static double dot(final float g[], final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w) {
162//        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y + g[2] * z + g[3] * w;
163//    }
164
165    protected static float dotf(final float[] g, final float x, final float y, final float z) {
166        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y + g[2] * z;
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, long)} with the initial seed given to this object.
171     *
172     * @param x X input
173     * @param y Y input
174     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
175     */
176    public double getNoise(final double x, final double y) {
177        return noise(x, y, defaultSeed);
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, long)}.
182     * 
183     * @param x X input
184     * @param y Y input
185     * @param seed will completely alter the shape of the noise if changed between calls
186     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
187     */
188    public double getNoiseWithSeed(final double x, final double y, final long seed) {
189        return noise(x, y, seed);
190    }
191    /**
192     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, double, long)} with the initial seed given to this object.
193     * 
194     * @param x X input
195     * @param y Y input
196     * @param z Z input
197     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
198     */
199    public double getNoise(final double x, final double y, final double z) {
200        return noise(x, y, z, defaultSeed);
201    }
202    /**
203     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, double, long)}.
204     * 
205     * @param x X input
206     * @param y Y input
207     * @param z Z input
208     * @param seed will completely alter the shape of the noise if changed between calls
209     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
210     */
211    public double getNoiseWithSeed(final double x, final double y, final double z, final long seed) {
212        return noise(x, y, z, seed);
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, double, double, long)} with the initial seed given to this object.
217     * 
218     * @param x X input
219     * @param y Y input
220     * @param z Z input
221     * @param w W input (fourth-dimension)
222     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
223     */
224    public double getNoise(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w) {
225        return noise(x, y, z, w, defaultSeed);
226    }
227    /**
228     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, double, double, long)}.
229     * @param x X input
230     * @param y Y input
231     * @param z Z input
232     * @param w W input (fourth-dimension)
233     * @param seed will completely alter the shape of the noise if changed between calls
234     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
235     */
236    public double getNoiseWithSeed(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w, final long seed) {
237        return noise(x, y, z, w, seed);
238    }

241    /**
242     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, long)} with 123456789 as the seed.
243     *
244     * @param xin X input
245     * @param yin Y input
246     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
247     */
248    public static double noise(final double xin, final double yin){
249        return SeededNoise.noise(xin, yin, 123456789);
250    }

252    /**
253     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, long)}.
254     *
255     * @param xin X input
256     * @param yin Y input
257     * @param seed will completely alter the shape of the noise if changed between calls
258     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
259     */
260    public static double noise(final double xin, final double yin, final long seed) {
261        return SeededNoise.noise(xin, yin, seed);
262    }

273    public static double noise(final double xin, final double yin, final double zin){
274        return SeededNoise.noise(xin, yin, zin, 123456789);

279     * @param xin X input
280     * @param yin Y input
281     * @param zin Z input
282     * @param seed will completely alter the shape of the noise if changed between calls
283     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive

285    public static double noise(final double xin, final double yin, final double zin, final long seed){ 
286        return SeededNoise.noise(xin, yin, zin, seed);

289    /**
290     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, double, double, long)} with 123456789 as the seed.
291     * @param x X input
292     * @param y Y input
293     * @param z Z input
294     * @param w W input (fourth-dimensional)
295     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
296     */
297    public static double noise(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w) {
298        return SeededNoise.noise(x, y, z, w, 123456789);
299    }
300
301    /**
302     * Delegates to {@link SeededNoise#noise(double, double, double, double, long)}.
303     * @param x X input
304     * @param y Y input
305     * @param z Z input
306     * @param w W input (fourth-dimensional)
307     * @param seed will completely alter the shape of the noise if changed between calls
308     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
309     */
310    public static double noise(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w, final long seed) {
311        return SeededNoise.noise(x, y, z, w, seed);
312    }

315//    public static double noise(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w, final long seed)
316//    {
317//        // The skewing and unskewing factors are hairy again for the 4D case
318//
319//        // Skew the (x,y,z,w) space to figure out which cell of 24 simplices
320//        // we're in
321//        double s = (x + y + z + w) * F4; // Factor for 4D skewing
322//        int i = fastFloor(x + s);
323//        int j = fastFloor(y + s);
324//        int k = fastFloor(z + s);
325//        int l = fastFloor(w + s);
326//        double t = (i + j + k + l) * G4; // Factor for 4D unskewing
327//        double X0 = i - t; // Unskew the cell origin back to (x,y,z,w) space
328//        double Y0 = j - t;
329//        double Z0 = k - t;
330//        double W0 = l - t;
331//        double x0 = x - X0; // The x,y,z,w distances from the cell origin
332//        double y0 = y - Y0;
333//        double z0 = z - Z0;
334//        double w0 = w - W0;
335//        // For the 4D case, the simplex is a 4D shape I won't even try to
336//        // describe.
337//        // To find out which of the 24 possible simplices we're in, we need
338//        // to figure out the magnitude ordering of x0, y0, z0 and w0.
339//        // The method below is a good way of finding the ordering of x,y,z,w
340//        // and
341//        // then find the correct traversal order for the simplex we’re in.
342//        // First, six pair-wise comparisons are performed between each
343//        // possible pair
344//        // of the four coordinates, and the results are used to add up binary
345//        // bits
346//        // for an integer index.
347//        int c = (x0 > y0 ? 32 : 0) | (x0 > z0 ? 16 : 0) | (y0 > z0 ? 8 : 0) |
348//                (x0 > w0 ? 4 : 0) | (y0 > w0 ? 2 : 0) | (z0 > w0 ? 1 : 0);
349//
350//        // simplex[c] is a 4-vector with the numbers 0, 1, 2 and 3 in some
351//        // order.
352//        // Many values of c will never occur, since e.g. x>y>z>w makes x<z,
353//        // y<w and x<w
354//        // impossible. Only the 24 indices which have non-zero entries make
355//        // any sense.
356//        // We use a thresholding to set the coordinates in turn from the
357//        // largest magnitude.
358//        // The number 3 in the "simplex" array is at the position of the
359//        // largest coordinate.
360//
361//        // The integer offsets for the second simplex corner
362//        int i1 = simplex[c][0] >= 3 ? 1 : 0;
363//        int j1 = simplex[c][1] >= 3 ? 1 : 0;
364//        int k1 = simplex[c][2] >= 3 ? 1 : 0;
365//        int l1 = simplex[c][3] >= 3 ? 1 : 0;
366//        // The number 2 in the "simplex" array is at the second largest
367//        // coordinate.
368//
369//        // The integer offsets for the third simplex corner
370//        int i2 = simplex[c][0] >= 2 ? 1 : 0;
371//        int j2 = simplex[c][1] >= 2 ? 1 : 0;
372//        int k2 = simplex[c][2] >= 2 ? 1 : 0;
373//        int l2 = simplex[c][3] >= 2 ? 1 : 0;
374//        // The number 1 in the "simplex" array is at the second smallest
375//        // coordinate.
376//
377//        // The integer offsets for the fourth simplex corner
378//        int i3 = simplex[c][0] >= 1 ? 1 : 0;
379//        int j3 = simplex[c][1] >= 1 ? 1 : 0;
380//        int k3 = simplex[c][2] >= 1 ? 1 : 0;
381//        int l3 = simplex[c][3] >= 1 ? 1 : 0;
382//        // The fifth corner has all coordinate offsets = 1, so no need to
383//        // look that up.
384//        double x1 = x0 - i1 + G4; // Offsets for second corner in (x,y,z,w) coords
385//        double y1 = y0 - j1 + G4;
386//        double z1 = z0 - k1 + G4;
387//        double w1 = w0 - l1 + G4;
388//        double x2 = x0 - i2 + 2.0 * G4; // Offsets for third corner in (x,y,z,w) coords
389//        double y2 = y0 - j2 + 2.0 * G4;
390//        double z2 = z0 - k2 + 2.0 * G4;
391//        double w2 = w0 - l2 + 2.0 * G4;
392//        double x3 = x0 - i3 + 3.0 * G4; // Offsets for fourth corner in (x,y,z,w) coords
393//        double y3 = y0 - j3 + 3.0 * G4;
394//        double z3 = z0 - k3 + 3.0 * G4;
395//        double w3 = w0 - l3 + 3.0 * G4;
396//        double x4 = x0 - 1.0 + 4.0 * G4; // Offsets for last corner in (x,y,z,w) coords
397//        double y4 = y0 - 1.0 + 4.0 * G4;
398//        double z4 = z0 - 1.0 + 4.0 * G4;
399//        double w4 = w0 - 1.0 + 4.0 * G4;
400//
401//        final int s0 = (int)(seed & 63), s1 = (int)(seed >>> 6 & 63), s2 = (int)(seed >>> 12 & 63), s3 = (int)(seed >>> 18 & 63);
402//        final int gi0 = (perm_x[(i) + s0 & 255] ^ perm_y[(j) + s1 & 255]           ^ perm_z[(k) + s2 & 255]      ^ perm_w[(l) + s3 & 255]) & 63;
403//        final int gi1 = (perm_x[(i + i1) + s0 & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + j1) + s1 & 255] ^ perm_z[(k + k1) + s2 & 255] ^ perm_w[(l + l1) + s3 & 255]) & 63;
404//        final int gi2 = (perm_x[(i + i2) + s0 & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + j2) + s1 & 255] ^ perm_z[(k + k2) + s2 & 255] ^ perm_w[(l + l2) + s3 & 255]) & 63;
405//        final int gi3 = (perm_x[(i + i3) + s0 & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + j3) + s1 & 255] ^ perm_z[(k + k3) + s2 & 255] ^ perm_w[(l + l3) + s3 & 255]) & 63;
406//        final int gi4 = (perm_x[(i + 1) + s0 & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + 1) + s1 & 255]   ^ perm_z[(k + 1) + s2  & 255] ^ perm_w[(l + 1) + s3 & 255]) & 63;
407//        // Noise contributions from the five corners are n0 to n4
408//
409//        // Calculate the contribution from the five corners
410//        double t0 = 0.6 - x0 * x0 - y0 * y0 - z0 * z0 - w0 * w0, n0;
411//        if (t0 < 0) {
412//            n0 = 0.0;
413//        } else {
414//            t0 *= t0;
415//            n0 = t0 * t0 * dot(grad4f[gi0], x0, y0, z0, w0);
416//        }
417//        double t1 = 0.6 - x1 * x1 - y1 * y1 - z1 * z1 - w1 * w1, n1;
418//        if (t1 < 0) {
419//            n1 = 0.0;
420//        } else {
421//            t1 *= t1;
422//            n1 = t1 * t1 * dot(grad4f[gi1], x1, y1, z1, w1);
423//        }
424//        double t2 = 0.6 - x2 * x2 - y2 * y2 - z2 * z2 - w2 * w2,  n2;
425//        if (t2 < 0) {
426//            n2 = 0.0;
427//        } else {
428//            t2 *= t2;
429//            n2 = t2 * t2 * dot(grad4f[gi2], x2, y2, z2, w2);
430//        }
431//        double t3 = 0.6 - x3 * x3 - y3 * y3 - z3 * z3 - w3 * w3, n3;
432//        if (t3 < 0) {
433//            n3 = 0.0;
434//        } else {
435//            t3 *= t3;
436//            n3 = t3 * t3 * dot(grad4f[gi3], x3, y3, z3, w3);
437//        }
438//        double t4 = 0.6 - x4 * x4 - y4 * y4 - z4 * z4 - w4 * w4, n4;
439//        if (t4 < 0) {
440//            n4 = 0.0;
441//        } else {
442//            t4 *= t4;
443//            n4 = t4 * t4 * dot(grad4f[gi4], x4, y4, z4, w4);
444//        }
445//        // Sum up and scale the result to cover the range [-1,1]
446//        return 17.0 * (n0 + n1 + n2 + n3 + n4);
447//    }

489
490    /**
491     * 2D simplex noise returning a float; extremely similar to {@link #noise(double, double)}, but this may be slightly
492     * faster or slightly slower. This uses its parameters verbatim, so you should apply frequency changes yourself.
493     * This also cannot take a seed, while {@link #noise(double, double, long)} can.
494     * @param x x input
495     * @param y y input
496     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
497     */
498    public static float noiseAlt(double x, double y) {
499        //xin *= SCALE;
500        //yin *= SCALE;
501        float noise0, noise1, noise2; // from the three corners
502        float xin = (float)x, yin = (float)y;
503        // Skew the input space to figure out which simplex cell we're in
504        float skew = (xin + yin) * FastNoise.F2f; // Hairy factor for 2D
505        int i = fastFloor(xin + skew);
506        int j = fastFloor(yin + skew);
507        float t = (i + j) * FastNoise.G2f;
508        float X0 = i - t; // Unskew the cell origin back to (x,y) space
509        float Y0 = j - t;
510        float x0 = xin - X0; // The x,y distances from the cell origin
511        float y0 = yin - Y0;
512        // For the 2D case, the simplex shape is an equilateral triangle.
513        // determine which simplex we are in.
514        int i1, j1; // Offsets for second (middle) corner of simplex in (i,j)
515        // coords
516        if (x0 > y0) {
517            i1 = 1;
518            j1 = 0;
519        } // lower triangle, XY order: (0,0)->(1,0)->(1,1)
520        else {
521            i1 = 0;
522            j1 = 1;
523        } // upper triangle, YX order: (0,0)->(0,1)->(1,1)
524        // A step of (1,0) in (i,j) means a step of (1-c,-c) in (x,y), and
525        // a step of (0,1) in (i,j) means a step of (-c,1-c) in (x,y),
526        // where: c = (3-sqrt(3))/6
527        float x1 = x0 - i1 + FastNoise.G2f; // Offsets for middle corner in (x,y)
528        // unskewed coords
529        float y1 = y0 - j1 + FastNoise.G2f;
530        float x2 = x0 - 1f + FastNoise.H2f; // Offsets for last corner in (x,y)
531        // unskewed coords
532        float y2 = y0 - 1f + FastNoise.H2f;
533        // Work out the hashed gradient indices of the three simplex corners
534//        int gi0 = determine256(i + determine(j));
535//        int gi1 = determine256(i + i1 + determine(j + j1));
536//        int gi2 = determine256(i + 1 + determine(j + 1));
537        final int gi0 = perm_x[i & 255] ^ perm_y[j & 255];
538        final int gi1 = perm_x[i + i1 & 255] ^ perm_y[j + j1 & 255];
539        final int gi2 = perm_x[i + 1 & 255] ^ perm_y[j + 1 & 255];
540
541        // Calculate the contribution from the three corners
542        float t0 = 0.75f - x0 * x0 - y0 * y0;
543        if (t0 < 0) {
544            noise0 = 0.0f;
545        } else {
546            t0 *= t0;
547            noise0 = t0 * t0 * FastNoise.dotf(grad2f[gi0], x0, y0);
548            // for 2D gradient
549        }
550        float t1 = 0.75f - x1 * x1 - y1 * y1;
551        if (t1 < 0) {
552            noise1 = 0.0f;
553        } else {
554            t1 *= t1;
555            noise1 = t1 * t1 * FastNoise.dotf(grad2f[gi1], x1, y1);
556        }
557        float t2 = 0.75f - x2 * x2 - y2 * y2;
558        if (t2 < 0) {
559            noise2 = 0.0f;
560        } else {
561            t2 *= t2;
562            noise2 = t2 * t2 * FastNoise.dotf(grad2f[gi2], x2, y2);
563        }
564        // Add contributions from each corner to get the final noise value.
565        // The result is clamped to return values in the interval [-1,1].
566        return Math.max(-1f, Math.min(1f, 9.125f * (noise0 + noise1 + noise2)));
567    }
568
569    /**
570     * 3D simplex noise returning a float; extremely similar to {@link #noise(double, double, double)}, but this may
571     * be slightly faster or slightly slower. This uses its parameters verbatim, so you should apply frequency changes
572     * yourself. This also cannot take a seed, while {@link #noise(double, double, double, long)} can.
573     *
574     * @param x X input
575     * @param y Y input
576     * @param z Z input
577     * @return noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive
578     */
579    public static float noiseAlt(double x, double y, double z) {
580        //xin *= SCALE;
581        //yin *= SCALE;
582        //zin *= SCALE;
583        float xin = (float)x, yin = (float)y, zin = (float)z;
584        float n0, n1, n2, n3; // Noise contributions from the four corners
585        // Skew the input space to figure out which simplex cell we're in
586        float s = (xin + yin + zin) * FastNoise.F3f; // Very nice and simple skew
587        // factor for 3D
588        int i = fastFloor(xin + s);
589        int j = fastFloor(yin + s);
590        int k = fastFloor(zin + s);
591        float t = (i + j + k) * FastNoise.G3f;
592        float X0 = i - t; // Unskew the cell origin back to (x,y,z) space
593        float Y0 = j - t;
594        float Z0 = k - t;
595        float x0 = xin - X0; // The x,y,z distances from the cell origin
596        float y0 = yin - Y0;
597        float z0 = zin - Z0;
598        // For the 3D case, the simplex shape is a slightly irregular
599        // tetrahedron.
600        // determine which simplex we are in.
601        int i1, j1, k1; // Offsets for second corner of simplex in (i,j,k)
602        // coords
603        int i2, j2, k2; // Offsets for third corner of simplex in (i,j,k)
604        // coords
605        if (x0 >= y0) {
606            if (y0 >= z0) {
607                i1 = 1;
608                j1 = 0;
609                k1 = 0;
610                i2 = 1;
611                j2 = 1;
612                k2 = 0;
613            } // X Y Z order
614            else if (x0 >= z0) {
615                i1 = 1;
616                j1 = 0;
617                k1 = 0;
618                i2 = 1;
619                j2 = 0;
620                k2 = 1;
621            } // X Z Y order
622            else {
623                i1 = 0;
624                j1 = 0;
625                k1 = 1;
626                i2 = 1;
627                j2 = 0;
628                k2 = 1;
629            } // Z X Y order
630        } else { // x0<y0
631            if (y0 < z0) {
632                i1 = 0;
633                j1 = 0;
634                k1 = 1;
635                i2 = 0;
636                j2 = 1;
637                k2 = 1;
638            } // Z Y X order
639            else if (x0 < z0) {
640                i1 = 0;
641                j1 = 1;
642                k1 = 0;
643                i2 = 0;
644                j2 = 1;
645                k2 = 1;
646            } // Y Z X order
647            else {
648                i1 = 0;
649                j1 = 1;
650                k1 = 0;
651                i2 = 1;
652                j2 = 1;
653                k2 = 0;
654            } // Y X Z order
655        }
656        // A step of (1,0,0) in (i,j,k) means a step of (1-c,-c,-c) in
657        // (x,y,z),
658        // a step of (0,1,0) in (i,j,k) means a step of (-c,1-c,-c) in
659        // (x,y,z), and
660        // a step of (0,0,1) in (i,j,k) means a step of (-c,-c,1-c) in
661        // (x,y,z), where
662        // c = 1/6.
663        float x1 = x0 - i1 + FastNoise.G3f; // Offsets for second corner in (x,y,z)
664        // coords
665        float y1 = y0 - j1 + FastNoise.G3f;
666        float z1 = z0 - k1 + FastNoise.G3f;
667        float x2 = x0 - i2 + FastNoise.F3f; // Offsets for third corner in
668        // (x,y,z) coords
669        float y2 = y0 - j2 + FastNoise.F3f;
670        float z2 = z0 - k2 + FastNoise.F3f;
671        float x3 = x0 - 0.5f; // Offsets for last corner in
672        // (x,y,z) coords
673        float y3 = y0 - 0.5f;
674        float z3 = z0 - 0.5f;
675        // Work out the hashed gradient indices of the four simplex corners
676
677        /*
678        int ii = i & 255;
679        int jj = j & 255;
680        int kk = k & 255;
681
682        int gi0 = perm[ii + perm[jj + perm[kk]]] % 12;
683        int gi1 = perm[ii + i1 + perm[jj + j1 + perm[kk + k1]]] % 12;
684        int gi2 = perm[ii + i2 + perm[jj + j2 + perm[kk + k2]]] % 12;
685        int gi3 = perm[ii + 1 + perm[jj + 1 + perm[kk + 1]]] % 12;
686        */
687//        int gi0 = determine32(i + determine(j + determine(k)));
688//        int gi1 = determine32(i + i1 + determine(j + j1 + determine(k + k1)));
689//        int gi2 = determine32(i + i2 + determine(j + j2 + determine(k + k2)));
690//        int gi3 = determine32(i + 1 + determine(j + 1 + determine(k + 1)));
691        final int gi0 = (perm_x[(i) & 255] ^ perm_y[(j) & 255]           ^ perm_z[(k) + 67 & 255]) & 31;
692        final int gi1 = (perm_x[(i + i1) & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + j1) & 255] ^ perm_z[(k + k1) + 67 & 255]) & 31;
693        final int gi2 = (perm_x[(i + i2) & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + j2) & 255] ^ perm_z[(k + k2) + 67 & 255]) & 31;
694        final int gi3 = (perm_x[(i + 1) & 255] ^ perm_y[(j + 1) & 255]   ^ perm_z[(k + 1) + 67  & 255]) & 31;
695
696
697//        int gi0 = determineBounded(i + determine(j + determine(k)), 92);
698//        int gi1 = determineBounded(i + i1 + determine(j + j1 + determine(k + k1)), 92);
699//        int gi2 = determineBounded(i + i2 + determine(j + j2 + determine(k + k2)), 92);
700//        int gi3 = determineBounded(i + 1 + determine(j + 1 + determine(k + 1)), 92);
701
702        /*
703        int hash = (int) rawNoise(i + ((j + k * 0x632BE5AB) * 0x9E3779B9),
704                i + i1 + ((j + j1 + (k + k1) * 0x632BE5AB) * 0x9E3779B9),
705                i + i2 + ((j + j2 + (k + k2) * 0x632BE5AB) * 0x9E3779B9),
706                i + 1 + ((j + 1 + ((k + 1) * 0x632BE5AB)) * 0x9E3779B9),
707                seed);
708        int gi0 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12;
709        int gi1 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12;
710        int gi2 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12;
711        int gi3 = (hash >>> 4) % 12;
712        */
713
714        //int hash = (int) rawNoise(i, j, k, seed);
715        //int gi0 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12, gi1 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12, gi2 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12, gi3 = (hash >>>= 4) % 12;
716        // Calculate the contribution from the four corners
717        float t0 = 0.6f - x0 * x0 - y0 * y0 - z0 * z0;
718        if (t0 < 0) {
719            n0 = 0f;
720        } else {
721            t0 *= t0;
722            n0 = t0 * t0 * dotf(grad3f[gi0], x0, y0, z0);
723        }
724        float t1 = 0.6f - x1 * x1 - y1 * y1 - z1 * z1;
725        if (t1 < 0) {
726            n1 = 0f;
727        } else {
728            t1 *= t1;
729            n1 = t1 * t1 * dotf(grad3f[gi1], x1, y1, z1);
730        }
731        float t2 = 0.6f - x2 * x2 - y2 * y2 - z2 * z2;
732        if (t2 < 0) {
733            n2 = 0f;
734        } else {
735            t2 *= t2;
736            n2 = t2 * t2 * dotf(grad3f[gi2], x2, y2, z2);
737        }
738        float t3 = 0.6f - x3 * x3 - y3 * y3 - z3 * z3;
739        if (t3 < 0) {
740            n3 = 0f;
741        } else {
742            t3 *= t3;
743            n3 = t3 * t3 * dotf(grad3f[gi3], x3, y3, z3);
744        }
745        // Add contributions from each corner to get the final noise value.
746        // The result is clamped to stay just inside [-1,1]
747        return Math.max(-1f, Math.min(1f, 31.5f * (n0 + n1 + n2 + n3)));
748    }
749
750}
